> This only works because your website behind the form knows how to map IDs from 
> the  element to resource URLs on it's backend REST API. When the user 
> posts the form I assume the result is something like this:
> 
>   POST /show-item.aspx?id=1234 HTTP/1.1
> 
> How does the webserver know how to map "1234" into it's backend resource 
> http://rest.mysite.com/items/1234? 

Isn't that what libraries are for? Java has Jersey (JAX-RS) to map from your URI to method calls and a URI-builder to create state links.

Mark W.
